intro: Pleione fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed pleione, is a species of orchid native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, thriving in cool, humid environments with well-drained soil. Its flowering period usually occurs in spring, making it a sought-after ornamental plant among orchid enthusiasts. Pleione fimbriata is also valued for its ecological role in forest ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
